children.subject: Oops, posted on a wrong post, please delete :)

How would enrollment in EECS/CS classes work as a DS major? It looks like a lot of EECS/CS upper div's have a lot of relevance/importance for the major. Would DS still be treated the same as other STEM non-majors, like Stat/Math? Thanks.

I'm confused by your question. If you drop by the deadline, you will not receive a W and you will be enrolled in 12 units. 

Please note that L&S students must be enrolled in at least 13 units. I do not believe the system will allow you to drop below this number.

Just to add, you'll need to enroll in a class greater than or equal to 1 unit(s) before attempting to drop for the system to let you drop your CS class. There's plenty of DeCals that's still open atm.

Sorry for the confusion, i am a EECS major student, and because of financial aid SAP i have to pass 67% of courses I’m taking in Fall 2017.
I’m currently taking 3 upper division CS courses plus a 4 unit breadth course.
Following up with your reply, please confirm if I understood this correctly. if I drop one CS course, I will only be enrolled in 12 units for this semester on my transcript instead of 16. (Meaning that there won’t be any record of the course dropped before the deadline)
Thank you!

Yeah, as long as you drop your class BEFORE the deadline time this Friday (it's 11:59 pm I think? double check to be sure), there will be no record of that class on your transcript. But, the system won't let you go under the unit floor, so it'll block you from dropping it unless you have enough units to be at or above the unit floor after dropping the class (so, if your unit cap is 12, which I think is for EECS, the class is 4 units, and you're at 13 units, then you'll be blocked from dropping it since post-drop you'll be at 9 units. But, if you're at 16 units right now, then you'll be able to drop, because post-drop you'll be at 12 units, which is the unit floor).
Thank you so much for the follow up! :)
I am taking 16 units right now. If I drop one of CS course by the deadline, does not receiving “W” means that my attempted units for this semester will be 12 instead of 16?
You will be charged $10, but you will not have a W if you drop before the deadline.
If I drop my 1 unit CS195 before Friday, will it have a W and will I be charged $10?

history.content:
This Friday, 9/22/17, at 11:59pm, will be the last day students will have access to add/drop/swap classes for Fall 2017.

 

L&S students may change grading options up until end of 10th week of instruction, Friday, 10/27/17 at 11:59PM

EECS students should review relevant deadlines here: http://engineering.berkeley.edu/academic-deadlines

All drops starting next week, will have a “W” (withdrawn) grade. It is important that you are enrolled in the appropriate classes (including secondary components) to avoid a “W” due to switching classes. Discussion sections cannot be changed if a "W" grade exists on the class.

 

Students who are not enrolled in any classes by the end of Friday, 9/22/17, at 11:59pm will have their Fall 2017 appointments deleted on Monday, 9/25/17 and ineligible to enroll. Students will need to apply for readmission to enroll in a future term.
history.subject: Add/Drop Deadline - Friday, September 22, 2017

All drops starting next week, will have a “W” (withdrawn) grade. It is important that you are enrolled in the appropriate classes (including secondary components) to avoid a “W” due to switching classes. Discussion sections cannot be changed if a "W" grade exists on the class.

 

Students who are not enrolled in any classes by the end of Friday, 9/22/17, at 11:59pm will have their Fall 2017 appointments deleted on Monday, 9/25/17 and ineligible to enroll. Students will need to apply for readmission to enroll in a future term.
history.subject: Add/Drop Deadline - Friday, September 22, 2017
